items.title: FxPlanet: Random Planet Generator State of the Art!
items.summary: The world of NFTs continues to evolve, pushing the boundaries of digital…
items.content_html:
The world of NFTs continues to evolve, pushing the boundaries of digital art and creativity. One of the most exciting projects in the generative art space is FxPlanet, a 3D NFT generative collection built on the Tezos ꜩ blockchain.

The world of NFTs continues to evolve, pushing the boundaries of digital art and creativity. One of the most exciting projects in the generative art space is FxPlanet, a 3D NFT generative collection built on the Tezos ꜩ blockchain. With a total of 2000 unique, intricately designed planets, this collection showcases the perfect blend of art, technology, and procedural generation.

The Technology Behind FxPlanet

FxPlanet is not just another NFT collection—it’s an innovative fusion of Unity and complex procedural algorithms. The project took an immense amount of time, dedication, and technical expertise to perfect, especially when it came to refining the planet textures.

At its core, the project generates planets using multiple layers of noise in a highly complex manner. This ensures that each planet is truly one-of-a-kind, with distinct patterns, colors, and surface details that make them visually stunning.

What is fxhash?

fxhash is an open generative art platform that allows artists to create and mint generative artworks as NFTs on the Tezos blockchain. Unlike traditional NFT marketplaces, fxhash is specifically designed for generative art, where each minted piece is uniquely generated using code. This makes it the perfect platform for projects like FxPlanet, where every minted planet is entirely unique and created through procedural algorithms.

Live Experience on fxhash

One of the most exciting aspects of FxPlanet is that it is fully interactive. Unlike static NFT collections, FxPlanet allows users to explore and engage with their planets in real time. You can view the live project on fxhash: 👉 FxPlanet on fxhash

Additionally, users can view random variations of planets by clicking on the Variation button under the project showcase on the fxhash page.

Controls for Exploration

To enhance the experience, users can interact with their planets using the following controls:

  • Rotate around planets: Use the WASD keys or arrow keys.
  • Zoom In: Press E.
  • Zoom Out: Press Q.
  • Change Texture Resolution:
    • Full HD (1080p): Press 1.
    • 4K Texture: Press 2.
    • 8K Texture: Press 3.

Why FxPlanet Stands Out

  • Procedural Generation: Each planet is uniquely created using complex noise layering techniques.
  • High-Quality Textures: Users can experience the planets in up to 8K resolution.
  • Interactive Experience: Unlike traditional NFT art, FxPlanet allows users to explore and interact with their planets.
  • Tezos Blockchain: Being on Tezos ensures eco-friendly minting and low transaction costs.

Proposed Narration

Once upon a time, a God had a little daughter. The daughter liked to explore the planets on his father's cosmos. Suddenly the daughter got sick and died like a collapsing star. God gets alone, angry, depressed and finally mad. He turned all the universe to ash and mixed the ash of her daughter's soul with it to make her alive, But he failed. In the end, he decided to destroy himself to make a New cosmos of all generative planets from ash of himself and his daughter's soul to one more time in the eternity they can be with each other in a heart of a planet. If you listen carefully to the planets, you may hear them calling each other.

Conclusion

FxPlanet is more than just a collection; it’s a technological marvel in the NFT space. By combining procedural generation, high-resolution textures, and interactive 3D elements, it sets a new standard for digital art on the blockchain. If you’re looking for a unique, high-quality NFT experience, FxPlanet is definitely worth exploring!

🔗 Check it out on fxhash and start exploring your own digital planet today!

items.title: Boost Your Unity Development with ConcurrentTools-Package
items.summary: In game development, handling asynchronous tasks efficiently is crucial for maintaining smooth…
items.content_html:
In game development, handling asynchronous tasks efficiently is crucial for maintaining smooth gameplay and responsive UI interactions. Unity's built-in coroutine system is helpful, but it lacks robust support for task concurrency and thread safety.

Introduction

In game development, handling asynchronous tasks efficiently is crucial for maintaining smooth gameplay and responsive UI interactions. Unity's built-in coroutine system is helpful, but it lacks robust support for task concurrency and thread safety. That's where ConcurrentTools-Package comes in—a simple yet powerful task management tool designed to help developers run tasks asynchronously, schedule delayed executions, and manage concurrency seamlessly.

Why You Need a Task Manager in Unity

Unity operates on a single-threaded model for most game logic, meaning any long-running operation can cause frame drops or unresponsiveness. Here are a few key challenges developers face:

  • Long-running tasks blocking the main thread: Calling expensive operations (like network requests) directly can freeze gameplay.
  • Lack of easy async task management: Unity coroutines don't natively support async/await, making complex task management cumbersome.
  • Thread safety issues: Background tasks can't directly interact with Unity objects, requiring a safe way to transfer data back to the main thread.

ConcurrentTools-Package solves these issues by providing a streamlined way to manage tasks safely and efficiently in Unity.

Features of ConcurrentTools-Package

  • Easy-to-use API: Run async and concurrent tasks with minimal code.
  • Delayed Task Execution: Schedule tasks to run after a specified time.
  • Main Thread Execution: Ensure background tasks interact with Unity APIs safely.
  • Timeout Handling: Prevent infinite waits by setting execution limits.
  • Concurrency Support: Execute multiple tasks without affecting performance.

How to Get Started

Installation

  1. Open Unity and navigate to Package Manager (Window > Package Manager).
  2. Click Add package from git URL.
  3. Enter the repository URL and click Add.
  4. The package is now ready to use!

Basic Usage

Run a Simple Task

Want to execute a task safely on the main thread? Use EnumeratorRunner.Run.

EnumeratorRunner.Run(() =>
{
    Debug.Log("Running safely on the main thread.");
});

Run an Async Task with a Callback

Run a background operation and notify when it's done.

async Task FetchData()
{
    await Task.Delay(2000); // Simulate data fetching
    Debug.Log("Data fetched successfully.");
}

EnumeratorRunner.Run(FetchData, () =>
{
    Debug.Log("Task completed.");
});

Execute a Delayed Task

Need to trigger an event after a few seconds?

EnumeratorRunner.Run(() =>
{
    Debug.Log("This runs after a 3-second delay.");
}, 3f);

Handle Tasks with Timeout

Ensure a task doesn't hang forever.

async Task<int> LongProcess()
{
    await Task.Delay(6000); // Too long!
    return 42;
}

EnumeratorRunner.Run(LongProcess, (result) =>
{
    Debug.Log($"Result: {result}");
}, 5f); // Timeout after 5 seconds

Conclusion

Managing tasks in Unity can be challenging, but with ConcurrentTools-Package, you get an efficient and developer-friendly solution. Whether you need to handle async operations, execute delayed functions, or ensure smooth task execution, this tool is a game-changer.

Start using ConcurrentTools-Package today and take your Unity development to the next level!

items.title: MenuView-Package in Unity: Simple Menu Management Tool
items.summary: This is my simple UnityGameEngine menu management tool and I want to…
items.content_html:
This is my simple UnityGameEngine menu management tool and I want to share it with my friends. You can Create some Menus and switch between them and manage them at multiple layers.

Introduction

Managing menus efficiently in Unity can be challenging, especially when dealing with a single scene. To simplify this process, I created MenuView-Package, a simple and effective menu management tool for Unity Game Engine. With this tool, you can create menus, switch between them quickly using button functions, and manage them across different layers effortlessly.

Why I Created MenuView-Package

When developing games in Unity, I often found handling menus within a single scene to be cumbersome. Unity’s built-in UI management system requires manual toggling of GameObjects and tracking menu states, which can lead to unstructured and inefficient code.

I created MenuView-Package to:

  • Provide a structured and simple way to manage menus within a single scene.
  • Allow developers to switch between menus instantly via button functions.
  • Offer a reusable and scalable approach to menu navigation.
  • Reduce the need for manual UI state tracking.

With MenuView-Package, handling menus within a single scene becomes seamless, making it easier to maintain and extend UI systems in Unity projects.

What It Does & How It Simplifies Menu Handling

MenuView-Package provides an efficient way to create and manage multiple menus in Unity. It allows you to:

  • Create menus easily by inheriting from MenuView.
  • Switch between menus dynamically with simple commands.
  • Manage menus across multiple layers, ensuring structured navigation.
  • Avoid redundant UI state management, as the package keeps track of the last active view.
  • Call functions in UI buttons to switch menus rapidly without extra logic.

By handling menu navigation programmatically, this tool significantly reduces UI-related complexity and ensures a smoother development process.

Getting Started

Using MenuView-Package is straightforward. Follow these steps to integrate it into your Unity project:

1. Importing the Package

To use MenuView-Package, you need to import it via the Unity Package Manager:

  • Open Unity Package Manager.
  • Select Add package from git URL: MenuView-Package
  • Enter the package URL and import it into your project.

2. Creating a Menu Script

Each menu in your game should be defined as a script inheriting from MenuView. Here’s how you can set up your menu scripts:

Example 1: Main Game Menu

Create a script named MainGameMenu.cs and inherit from MenuView instead of MonoBehaviour.

using MenuViews;

public class MainGameMenu : MenuView
{
    protected override void Init()
    {
        // Initialize buttons, texts, events, and more
        throw new System.NotImplementedException();
    }
    
    // Available commands:
    // ChangeCurrentView<AuthMenu>();
    // ChangeToLastView();
    // LastView { get; }
    // GetCurrentView();
}

Example 2: Authentication Menu

Similarly, create another menu script for authentication, like AuthMenu.cs:

using MenuViews;

public class AuthMenu : MenuView
{
    protected override void Init()
    {
        throw new System.NotImplementedException();
    }
}

Example 3: Settings Menu

Another common menu is a settings menu. Here’s how you can create one:

using MenuViews;

public class SettingsMenu : MenuView
{
    protected override void Init()
    {
        // Initialize settings options here
    }
}

Example 4: Pause Menu

A pause menu can be added in a similar way:

using MenuViews;

public class PauseMenu : MenuView
{
    protected override void Init()
    {
        // Initialize pause menu options here
    }
}

Managing Menus

Once your menus are set up, you can manage them using various commands:

  • ChangeCurrentView<T>() - Switch to a specific menu view.
  • ChangeToLastView() - Return to the previous menu.
  • LastView - Retrieve the last active menu.
  • GetCurrentView() - Get the currently active menu.
  • CloseThisView() - Close the current menu.
  • CloseAll() - Close all menus in the current layer.

How to Use in UI Buttons

One of the key features of this package is the ability to call functions in UI buttons to switch menus easily. Here’s how you can do it:

  1. Attach a Button component to your UI button.
  2. In the OnClick() event of the button, add a function call like:
    • MainGameMenu.ChangeCurrentView<AuthMenu>();
    • AuthMenu.ChangeToLastView();

This makes switching between menus fast and seamless without writing extra logic.

Why Use MenuView-Package?

  • Easy to integrate – Just import the package and modify your menu scripts.
  • Simplifies menu switching – No need for complex UI state management.
  • Supports multiple UI layers – Useful for games with deep menu structures.
  • Works within a single scene – No need for scene transitions for menu changes.
  • Reduces development time – Provides a streamlined approach to menu navigation.

Conclusion

MenuView-Package is a lightweight and powerful tool to handle UI menus in Unity seamlessly. Whether you’re building a simple game or a complex application, this tool can help streamline your UI navigation. Feel free to try it out and share your feedback!

items.title: HEcsGravitySim: A High-Performance Gravity Simulation in Unity
items.summary: HEcsGravitySim is a multi-threaded gravity simulation using Unity's ECS and Job System…
items.content_html:
HEcsGravitySim is a multi-threaded gravity simulation using Unity's ECS and Job System for real-time performance. 🚀

Introduction

Gravity simulations are computationally expensive, especially when dealing with numerous objects. In this project, HEcsGravitySim, we tackle this challenge using Unity's ECS (Entity Component System) and Job System to leverage multi-threading for real-time calculations. Instead of processing thousands of gravitational interactions on a single thread, which would be highly inefficient, we distribute the computations across multiple threads for a significant performance boost.

The Problem: Gravity Calculation Bottleneck

In a naive implementation of a gravity simulation, each planet applies a force to every other planet. This results in a nested loop with O(n²) complexity, where each frame requires computing forces for every pair of planets. With 1000 planets, this means 1,000,000 force calculations per frame! Running this on a single thread would lead to severe performance issues.

The Solution: Multi-Threading and Data-Oriented Programming

To overcome this computational bottleneck, we use Unity's Data-Oriented Technology Stack (DOTS), which includes:

  • Job System – Enables multithreaded computations efficiently.
  • ECS (Entity Component System) – Provides a high-performance, data-oriented programming model.
  • Hybrid Renderer Package – Ensures optimized rendering.
  • Unity Physics (Havok Physics) – Handles physics interactions accurately.

By structuring the simulation using ECS and Jobs, we efficiently distribute calculations across multiple CPU cores, leading to a significant boost in performance and real-time simulation capabilities.

Gravity Calculation Formula

The gravitational force between two planets is calculated using Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation:

F=Gm1m2r2F = G \frac{m_1 m_2}{r^2}

Where:

  • FF is the gravitational force,
  • GG is the gravitational constant,
  • m1,m2m_1, m_2 are the masses of the two planets,
  • rr is the distance between the two planets.

Unity Implementation Example:

float3 direction = planet2.Position - planet1.Position;
float distanceSquared = math.lengthsq(direction) + 0.0001f; // Avoid division by zero
float forceMagnitude = (G * planet1.Mass * planet2.Mass) / distanceSquared;
float3 force = math.normalize(direction) * forceMagnitude;

Project Breakdown

1. Random Planet Generator

  • A class that generates randomly placed planets within the simulation space.
  • Assigns each planet a random velocity and mass.

2. Planet Component Data

  • Stores essential planet properties such as:
    • Position
    • Velocity
    • Mass

3. Gravity System

  • Uses Entity Query to fetch all planets.
  • Executes a multithreaded job each frame to calculate gravitational forces efficiently.
  • Applies forces to the Velocity Component, allowing the physics engine to update positions automatically.

4. Job System for Parallel Processing

  • Each frame, the system:
    1. Loops over all planet entities using nested loops.
    2. Distributes the calculations across multiple CPU cores using Jobs.
    3. Applies the calculated forces to update velocity components.
    4. The physics engine then computes the new positions.

Performance Gains

By implementing ECS and Job System, we achieve:

  • Massively improved performance due to parallel processing.
  • Real-time gravity simulation with thousands of planets.
  • Efficient memory management, reducing CPU bottlenecks.
  • Smooth rendering using the Hybrid Renderer package.

Conclusion

HEcsGravitySim showcases the power of Data-Oriented Programming in Unity, enabling efficient and scalable physics simulations. With ECS, Job System, and Unity Physics, we can simulate complex gravitational interactions at real-time speeds, even with thousands of entities.

If you're interested in high-performance game development or physics simulations, exploring Unity's DOTS ecosystem is a great step forward!

Stay tuned for further improvements and optimizations! 🚀

GitHub Repository

Check out the source code on GitHub: HEcsGravitySim

items.title: Rainy Cloud: A Melancholic Yet Hopeful Puzzle Adventure
items.summary: Rainy Cloud is an atmospheric 2D puzzle game born from the Brackeys…
items.content_html:
Rainy Cloud is an atmospheric 2D puzzle game born from the Brackeys Game Jam 2021.1. Created in just seven days by a small team, it blends chaos and serenity, offering a unique, emotionally charged experience that stays with players long after gameplay.

Introduction

Game jams are a breeding ground for innovation, where developers push their limits under extreme time constraints. Among the many titles born from such creative pressure, Rainy Cloud stands out as an emotionally charged, atmospheric 2D puzzle game that encapsulates both chaos and serenity. Developed during the Brackeys Game Jam 2021.1, this prototype is a testament to what a small team can achieve in just seven days.

A collaborative effort by Hooman Jalalpoor, Mahdi Motazedi, Hesam Jalalpoor, and Golara Mozdbar, Rainy Cloud weaves a delicate balance between urgency and calmness, delivering a gaming experience that lingers long after the screen fades to black.

The Story: A Race Against the Rising Waters

Set in a world drowning under relentless rainfall, Rainy Cloud follows the journey of a young girl and her mystical fox companion. With floodwaters steadily rising, their only hope for survival lies in scavenging materials to construct a boat before it's too late.

The game’s narrative unfolds through its environments rather than explicit storytelling. Crumbling structures, eerie silhouettes in the distance, and the ever-present sound of rain create a backdrop of desolation. Yet, within this bleak setting, hope flickers in the form of the girl and her fox—an unbreakable duo navigating the chaos together.

Golara Mozdbar, the game’s designer, describes their approach: “We wanted to reinterpret ‘chaos’ as something subtle but urgent. Instead of explosions and destruction, our chaos is the creeping inevitability of rising waters.”

Gameplay: Teamwork and Tension

Rainy Cloud is more than just a puzzle game—it’s a test of strategy, quick thinking, and cooperation. Players must harness the unique abilities of both the girl and the fox to navigate the perilous landscape.

Character Abilities:

  • The Girl – Stronger and able to move heavy objects, she can reach higher platforms and construct elements needed for the boat.
  • The Fox – Agile and small, the fox can squeeze through narrow gaps, activate distant switches, and even provide magical assistance.

The game seamlessly integrates these mechanics into puzzles that require players to think critically. Whether it’s triggering a mechanism to unlock a new path or coordinating actions to escape rising water, every decision counts.

The ticking pressure of the flood adds an element of urgency—forcing players to balance exploration with efficiency. The result? A tense yet rewarding gameplay experience that makes every victory feel hard-earned.

Art & Sound: A Dreamlike Atmosphere

Mahdi Motazedi, the game’s artist and animator, has crafted a world that is both whimsical and melancholic. The stark contrast between the glowing fox and the dark, rain-drenched surroundings heightens the sense of isolation, while the fluid animations add a layer of realism to the characters' emotions.

The audio design, led by Hesam Jalalpoor, further enhances the experience. With soft piano melodies intertwined with the ever-present sound of rain and distant thunder, the game creates an atmosphere that is at once soothing and unsettling. “We wanted the music to reflect both the desperation and the quiet determination of our characters,” Hesam explains.

The Challenge of Game Jams

Game jams demand a tight workflow, and the Rainy Cloud team knew they had limited time to execute their vision. Hooman Jalalpoor, the Unity developer, emphasized the importance of prioritization:

“We focused first on movement, puzzles, and the flood mechanic. Once that core loop was polished, we filled in the details with art and sound.”

One of the team's standout achievements was implementing configurable controls, allowing players to seamlessly switch between keyboard, mouse, and controllers—a feature not often seen in jam projects.

A Short but Impactful Experience

Although Rainy Cloud is labeled a prototype, it feels surprisingly complete. A single playthrough lasts just a few minutes, yet those minutes are packed with intricate puzzles, evocative visuals, and a lingering sense of urgency.

Since its launch on itch.io (play here), Rainy Cloud has received praise for its emotional depth and creative interpretation of the jam’s theme, “Let There Be Chaos.”

Final Thoughts: The Beauty of Chaos

At its core, Rainy Cloud is a story about resilience, teamwork, and hope in the face of an overwhelming force. It is a reminder that even within the constraints of a game jam, beauty can emerge from chaos.

Whether you’re a fan of puzzle games, indie titles, or simply appreciate thoughtful storytelling, Rainy Cloud is well worth your time. Dive into the storm, embrace the challenge, and uncover the magic within the rain.

Game Details

  • Title: Rainy Cloud
  • Platforms: Windows
  • Developers: Hooman Jalalpoor, Mahdi Motazedi, Hesam Jalalpoor, Golara Mozdbar
  • Tags: 2D, puzzle, atmospheric, indie, game jam

🎮 Play Rainy Cloud here: itch.io link

items.title: Balls of Chaos: A Game Jam Triumph in 100 Seconds of Mayhem
items.summary: Survive 100 seconds of chaos in Balls of Chaos, a fast-paced bullet-hell…
items.content_html:
Survive 100 seconds of chaos in Balls of Chaos, a fast-paced bullet-hell arcade game. Strategize, dodge, and outlast an endless swarm of balls!

A High-Speed Descent into Chaos

Imagine stepping into an arena where the only rule is survival. The clock is ticking, the walls are closing in, and an ever-growing swarm of balls threatens to consume everything in sight. Welcome to Balls of Chaos, a relentless bullet-hell arcade experience that blends strategy, reflexes, and sheer nerve into 100 seconds of escalating madness.

Developed in just seven days for the Brackeys 2021.2 Game Jam, Balls of Chaos was born from the theme “Let There Be Chaos.” The result? A fast-paced, pixel-perfect indie game that ranked among the Top 50 entries and left players both exhilarated and exhausted.

The Gameplay: Simple Premise, Insane Execution

At its core, Balls of Chaos is a game about endurance. The concept is straightforward:

  1. Survive 100 seconds without being overwhelmed.
  2. Defend against multiplying balls that split and evolve with every impact.
  3. Rack up points by bouncing balls off your paddle—but beware, every hit spawns new threats.

The game’s ball-splitting system is what takes it from a simple arcade game to a finely tuned chaos simulator:

  • A Mother Ball spawns and moves toward your paddle.
  • When it collides, it splits into two balls, increasing the total count.
  • Balls gain value and speed with each impact, creating an ever-growing swarm of threats.
  • You earn points equal to a ball’s value when successfully bouncing it.
  • Letting a ball slip past results in even more chaos—so keep your defenses tight!

The first 30 seconds might seem manageable, but as time progresses, the arena transforms into a neon-lit hurricane of bouncing orbs. Strategy becomes key: Do you risk increasing the ball count for a higher score, or do you play conservatively to extend your survival?

The Madness of the Final 10 Seconds

By the time you reach the 90-second mark, Balls of Chaos has fully embraced its name. The screen explodes into a high-speed flurry of movement, and only the most skilled players will hold their ground. If you’ve made it this far, congratulations—you’re officially a chaos master.

But for those who crave an even greater challenge, a secret mode awaits. Only the bravest will uncover its secrets and push the limits of their reflexes.

Aesthetic & Art Style: Controlled Chaos in Pixel Form

Visually, Balls of Chaos embraces a retro-futuristic pixel art style that pays homage to classic arcade games while adding a modern twist. The vibrant color palette was carefully chosen to balance chaos and clarity, ensuring that the action remains visually engaging yet not overwhelming.

The primary background colors were selected to create a stark contrast with the bouncing balls, allowing players to track movement effortlessly. The glowing neon reds, greens, and blues enhance the feeling of urgency, making every moment feel like an electrifying battle for survival. The pixelated aesthetic, masterfully crafted by Htet Oo Lwin, not only adds nostalgic appeal but also complements the game’s fast-paced mechanics.

By mixing old-school pixel graphics with high-speed animation effects, Balls of Chaos successfully captures the thrill of classic bullet-hell games while carving out a distinct identity of its own.

Why You’ll Love (or Rage Quit) Balls of Chaos

  • Bullet-Hell with Brains – Unlike mindless arcade shooters, Balls of Chaos demands both quick reflexes and strategic thinking.
  • Secret Mode & Online Leaderboards – Compete against global players and unlock hidden chaos if you dare.
  • Pixel-Perfect Aesthetic – The vibrant pixel art by Htet Oo Lwin and an adrenaline-pumping synthwave soundtrack by Hesam create an immersive, retro-futuristic vibe.
  • A Game Jam Masterpiece – Developed in just seven days by a four-person indie team, this game is a testament to raw creativity and skill under pressure.

The Dev Team Behind the Chaos

Balls of Chaos was crafted by an all-star indie team:

  • Madzaa – Game Design
  • Hooman Jalalpoor – Programming
  • Htet Oo Lwin – Art
  • Hesam Jalalpoor – Music & SFX

Play Now – If You Can Handle It

Think you have what it takes to survive Balls of Chaos?

🕹️ Download Now on itch.io: madzaa.itch.io/balls-of-chaos

🎮 Available for Windows, Linux, and Android.

Final Thoughts from the Developers

“We set out to create something that feels fast, fun, and punishing all at once—a game where every second is a battle. We think we nailed it. And that secret mode? Well, let’s just say it’s where the real chaos begins.” – Hooman Jalalpoor, Programmer

So, the question is: Can you outlast the chaos? Step up, take the challenge, and see if you can secure a place on the leaderboard. 🔥

#BallsOfChaos #IndieGame #BulletHell #GameJam

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ “An adrenaline-fueled ride from start to finish.”

items.title: Impasse: A Puzzle-Action Gem Born from Collaboration and Hope
items.summary: Impasse: A 2D puzzle-action game by Hooman & Hesam Jalalpoor, born from…
items.content_html:
Impasse: A 2D puzzle-action game by Hooman & Hesam Jalalpoor, born from a game jam, blending strategy, art, and emotion.

Introduction

In the bustling world of indie game development, few stories resonate as deeply as those born from passion, tight deadlines, and creative synergy. Impasse, a 2D isometric puzzle-action game developed during a game jam, is one such story. Created by Hooman Jalalpoor (programmer/Unity developer) and Hesam Jalalpoor (music, SFX, and artist), this prototype earned 1st place at Isfahan University’s Game Dev Camp Final Jam. With its unique blend of strategic gameplay, emotional storytelling, and striking art, Impasse stands as a testament to what small teams can achieve under pressure.

Play Impasse on Android

Itch Page of Game

The Story: A Tale of Friendship and Hope
Impasse centers on two friends navigating a world fraught with challenges. Tasked with battling a formidable boss, the duo must rely on teamwork and ingenuity to survive. The game’s narrative, inspired by the jam’s theme of “Hope,” weaves a heartfelt story about perseverance and trust. Players are drawn into a minimalist yet evocative world where solving puzzles isn’t just about progression—it’s about rekindling hope in the face of despair.

Gameplay Mechanics and Game Design
Blending puzzle-solving with action-packed combat, Impasse offers a fresh take on the genre:

  • Level Variety: The game features diverse level designs that evolve as players progress. The first level introduces a boat-driving segment, immersing players in an engaging movement-based challenge before transitioning into the core gameplay.
  • Isometric Puzzle-Solving: The main gameplay revolves around an isometric puzzle system, where players control two characters simultaneously. Some blocks obstruct movement for one character while allowing the other to pass, requiring strategic coordination to solve each level.
  • Boss Battle Mechanics: The game features a 2D boss fight sequence, where the player moves between three positions on the screen to dodge the boss’s powerful punches. This mix of action and puzzle-solving keeps gameplay fresh and dynamic.
  • Cooperative Elements: Whether playing solo or switching between characters, teamwork is essential for overcoming obstacles and reaching new areas.

The game’s jam roots shine through its concise design—every mechanic serves the story and theme.

Art and Sound: A Feast for the Senses
Hesam Jalalpoor’s contributions elevate Impasse into an artistic triumph:

  • Visual Style: The isometric 2D art blends crisp geometry with muted, atmospheric colors, reflecting the game’s tone of struggle and hope. The environments are designed with a minimalist yet detailed approach, featuring soft gradients and carefully crafted textures that give the world a hand-painted feel. Character designs emphasize expressive animations, ensuring that movements feel fluid and natural. The color palette strategically shifts between warm and cool tones, reinforcing the emotional highs and lows of the journey. Lighting effects, subtle shadows, and particle details enhance the immersion, making the world feel alive despite its stylized simplicity.
  • Music and SFX: Hesam’s haunting melodies and immersive sound effects deepen the emotional weight. From the clang of combat to the subtle hum of puzzles, the audio design pulls players into the world.
    Explore Hesam’s portfolio: hesam.jalalpoor.com.

Technical Execution: Unity-Powered Precision
Hooman Jalalpoor’s technical prowess ensured Impasse’s smooth gameplay:

  • What is Unity?: Unity is a powerful, cross-platform game engine widely used in game development. It offers a robust suite of tools for building both 2D and 3D experiences and is favored for its flexibility, real-time rendering, and support for multiple platforms, including Android, where Impasse was developed.
  • Unity’s Role in Impasse: Several of Unity’s technical features contributed to the game’s design and execution:
    • 2D Isometric Rendering Pipeline: Enabled smooth, perspective-based visuals that enhance the depth of puzzles and environments.
    • Physics-Based Interactions: Allowed for realistic movement mechanics, including the boat-driving section and interactive puzzle elements.
    • Animation Tools: Provided smooth character animations, ensuring natural movement in both puzzle-solving and action sequences.
    • Optimization Capabilities: Helped maintain a stable frame rate and ensure seamless performance on mobile devices.
  • Prototype Scope: Designed as a jam game, Impasse balances polish with creative experimentation, leaving room for future expansion.

Reception and Legacy
Impasse’s accolades speak volumes:

  • 🏆 1st Place at Isfahan University’s Game Dev Jam.
  • Praise for its innovative fusion of puzzle mechanics and narrative depth.

While still a prototype, its success hints at potential for a full release.

Play Impasse Today!
Ready to test your wits and courage? Dive into the demo on itch.io:
Play Impasse on Android

Conclusion: A Glimpse of Indie Game Magic
Impasse proves that constraints—like time and resources—can spark creativity rather than stifle it. Hooman’s technical mastery and Hesam’s artistic vision create an experience that’s as thoughtful as it is engaging. For puzzle enthusiasts and story-driven gamers alike, Impasse is a prototype with the heart of a full-fledged title—and a promising glimpse into its developers’ futures.

Exploring Generative Art: A Journey Through My Projects on fxhash

Generative art is a fascinating intersection of creativity and technology, where algorithms and code come together to produce unique, ever-evolving visual experiences. As an artist and programmer, I’ve been deeply immersed in this world, creating generative art projects that blend procedural techniques with storytelling and aesthetics. Most of my work is published on fxhash, a platform dedicated to generative art, and I’m excited to share some of my projects with you.

You can explore my artistic journey on my blog: parallax.tez.page.

What is Generative Art?

Generative art is a form of digital art where the artist creates a system or algorithm that autonomously generates artwork. Each piece is unique, often influenced by random variables or user inputs. This process allows for endless variations, making every output a one-of-a-kind creation.

For me, generative art is more than just code—it’s a way to tell stories, evoke emotions, and explore the boundaries of creativity.

My Generative Art Projects

Here are some of my projects that I’ve published on fxhash:

1. Taiga

Taiga is a generative art project inspired by the vast, untamed wilderness of boreal forests. The algorithm creates intricate landscapes filled with towering trees and creatures. Each piece is a snapshot of a serene, otherworldly forest, inviting viewers to lose themselves in its beauty.

2. Auadream

Auadream is a dreamlike exploration of underwater worlds. The algorithm generates abstract aquatic scenes, blending vibrant colors and fluid shapes to create a sense of movement and depth. Each piece feels like a glimpse into a surreal ocean, teeming with life and mystery.

3. Spradow

Spradow is a playful take on generative art, combining geometric patterns with organic forms. The algorithm creates dynamic compositions that balance order and chaos, resulting in visually striking pieces that are both structured and spontaneous.

4. Lfetover

Lfetover is a project that explores the concept of remnants and fragments. The algorithm generates abstract compositions that feel like remnants of a forgotten world, blending textures, shapes, and colors to create a sense of nostalgia and intrigue.

5. Once Upon a Time

Once Upon a Time is a storytelling project that uses generative art to create whimsical, fairy-tale-like scenes. Each piece is a unique narrative, filled with magical elements and dreamy landscapes. The algorithm weaves together characters, settings, and events, inviting viewers to imagine their own stories.

Why fxhash?

I chose fxhash as the platform for my generative art projects because of its vibrant community and commitment to supporting artists. The platform allows me to share my work with a global audience and connect with other creators who share my passion for generative art.

Each project on fxhash is minted as a unique NFT, ensuring that every piece is one-of-a-kind. This adds an extra layer of value and authenticity to the artwork, making it a truly special experience for collectors.

The Process Behind the Art

Creating generative art is a deeply iterative process. It starts with an idea—a story, a feeling, or a visual concept. From there, I write code to bring that idea to life, experimenting with algorithms, parameters, and visual elements until the artwork feels just right.

The beauty of generative art lies in its unpredictability. Even as the creator, I’m often surprised by the outputs, discovering new patterns and possibilities with each iteration.

Explore My Work

If you’re curious to see more of my generative art projects, head over to my blog: parallax.tez.page. You’ll find detailed descriptions, behind-the-scenes insights, and links to my fxhash collections.

Generative art is a journey, and I’m thrilled to have you along for the ride. Whether you’re an artist, a collector, or simply someone who appreciates the beauty of code-driven creativity, I hope my work inspires you to see the world in new and unexpected ways.

FxHash Page

Let’s continue to push the boundaries of art and technology together. Follow my journey on fxhash and parallax.tez.page, and stay tuned for more generative art projects in the future!
